As an advice， if you found trouble following lecture 37 and 38, please read through chapter 13 of simmons's textbook, and do the exercises of each section as many as you can, when you finished chapter 13, you'll be comfortable with power series and Taylor series.

It was Achilles and tortoise. Achilles can never get to the tortoise who had a head start because every time Achilles halves the distance tortoise has moved ahead.  The full explanation why you can travel two meters even if you always apparently halve your approaches is that at the same time as you halve the distance you halve your travel time as your speed is constant. So it does not take infinite amount of time to travel the distance but both the distance and time follow the same geometrical progression.
